abstract.p: Simon & Schuster names Kristina Peterson president of its children's publishing division, effective Aug 14; succeeds Rick Richter, who is named president of sales and distribution (S)

block.p: The book publisher Simon & Schuster has named Kristina Peterson president of its children's publishing division, effective on Aug. 14.
Ms. Peterson, 49 years old, is currently president of the children's media group at Random House, the book publishing unit of the German media company Bertelsmann.
The book publisher Simon & Schuster has named Kristina Peterson president of its children's publishing division, effective on Aug. 14.
Ms. Peterson, 49 years old, is currently president of the children's media group at Random House, the book publishing unit of the German media company Bertelsmann.

Random House said her position was being eliminated as its children's media group is reduced to the children's books division. Craig Virden, 47, remains president and publisher of Random House children's books.
Ms. Peterson succeeds Rick Richter, 39, who was named president of the sales and distribution division at Simon & Schuster. The company is a unit of Viacom Inc., a media company based in New York.
